description: The longer a customer has been with the company, the less likely they are to churn.
Customers who have lower monthly payment amounts may be less likely to churn.
Customers who have had more interactions with customer support may be more likely to churn.
Customers who actively use additional features of the product may be less likely to churn.
Customers with higher satisfaction ratings are less likely to churn.
Customers on longer contract lengths may be less likely to churn.
Customers who have received multiple competitor offers may be more likely to churn.
Customers who use the product frequently are less likely to churn.
Customers with a higher lifetime value may be less likely to churn.
Customers who have a history of billing issues may be more likely to churn.
